Sticking to these tips should help you get the best possible text-extraction results out of your image.

• Although the quality of the output does not depend on the amount of text extracted, but the text tends to get blurry and the text quality diminishes as the text size is reduced. In order to keep the text size above minimum detection limits, try not to extract the whole page in one go. Rather, crop smaller areas or paragraphs and extract text out of them.

• Orientation and skew matters. Try to keep the image in perfectly portrait orientation to get the best results. At the moment the application supports rotating the image by 90 degrees so switching between landscape and portrait modes should not be an issue. Rotating by angles other than multiples of 90 degrees is not supported at the moment but perhaps in some future release. Placing the document on a flat surface should also help eliminate skew.

• Moving while taking photos can cause blurry image causing the text to be blurry too. This also affects the text-extraction performance. Features like sharpening the image and changing image contrast/brightness for best extraction results will be added in a future release.
• Pictures, shapes and other sources of "noise" shold be cropped out as they might adversely affect the results.

• Text within tables and or text placed randomly on the page will be detected fine but the results will not contain the same text alignment as on the image. A better approach is to extract text out of each segment of text individually.

The developer is an expat in Sweden and this app has been made out of necessity since he has a tough time reading documents in Swedish. However, it should not discourage the users from learning a new language.
This product uses Tesseract OCR 3.02 as the OCR engine. Translation is provided by Microsoft Bing translator.
